Calculates any matching birthdays in the data and the probability of having a
matching birthday (i.e. birthday paradox) — birthday_paradox
code: df <- data.frame(   name = c("kevin", "stacey"),   birthday = c(as.Date("2001-01-01"), as.Date("2002-01-02")) ) birthdays <- birthdays(df) birthday_paradox(birthdays) #>   num_coincidence prob_coincindence  #>       0.000000000       0.002739726

code: df = data.frame(   name = c("kevin", "stacey"),   birthday = c(as.Date("2001-01-01"), as.Date("2002-01-02")) ) birthdays(df) #> A `birthdays` object with 2 rows and 2 cols   # generate large randomised `<birthdays>` objects  df <- data.frame(   name = randomNames::randomNames(10),   birthday = sample(     x = seq.Date(       from = as.Date("2020-01-01"),       to = as.Date("2022-01-01"),       by = 1),     size = 10   ) ) birthdays <- birthdays(df)
